events.title: Discovery of Uranus
events.description: William Herschel discovered Uranus, the seventh planet from the Sun, expanding the known boundaries of our solar system for the first time in modern history.
events.significance: This discovery was pivotal in astronomy, broadening the understanding of the solar system and triggering further planetary research.

events.title: Assassination of Tsar Alexander II of Russia
events.description: Tsar Alexander II was fatally wounded in an attack by members of the revolutionary group 'People's Will' in St. Petersburg, leading to his death a few hours later.
events.significance: His assassination led to a period of political repression and influenced the course of the Russian revolutionary movements.

events.title: Cities of Constantinople and Angora officially renamed Istanbul and Ankara
events.description: The Turkish government officially changed the names of Constantinople and Angora to Istanbul and Ankara as part of efforts to modernize and nationalize the country.
events.significance: This reflected the shift towards Turkish national identity following the establishment of the Republic of Turkey.

events.title: Titanic Wreck Site Found
events.description: An expedition led by Robert Ballard discovered the wreck of the RMS Titanic on the bottom of the North Atlantic Ocean.
events.significance: The discovery brought closure to one of the most famous maritime disasters and spurred interest in deep-sea exploration and preservation efforts.

events.title: Pope Francis becomes the 266th Pope
events.description: Jorge Mario Bergoglio was elected Pope Francis, becoming the first pope from the Americas and the first Jesuit pope in history.
events.significance: His papacy marked a notable shift in the Catholic Church with an emphasis on humility, social justice, and outreach to marginalized communities.
